greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of duplicate digits of n.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
example: a(11) = 1 because 11 has two total decimal digits but only one distinct digit (1) and 2-1=1.
Similarly, a(3653135) = 7 (total digits) - 4 (distinct digits: 1,3,5,6) = 3 (There are three duplicate digits here, namely, 3, 3 and 5).
maple: for n from 0 to q do a:=n; b:=[];
while a>0 do c:=a mod 10; b:=[op(b),c]; a:=trunc(a/10); od;
od; end: A107846(10^4); # _Paolo P. Lava_, Apr 18 2013
program: a107846 = length . concatMap tail . group . sort . show :: Integer -> Int
xref: Cf. A055642 (Total decimal digits of n), A043537 (Distinct decimal digits of n).
results.author: _Rick L. Shepherd_, May 24, 2005
